Message - Class in com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages
Message.java

Created on 5 January 2011, 17:34

Represents the details of a message that is to be submitted via the http api.
Not instanciated directly, but instead via one of the sub-classes that represent a particular message type
Message(int, String, String, String, byte[], byte[], String, boolean, boolean, String, String, int) - Constructor for class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.Message
Instanciate a new message request.
This constructor exposes the full range of possible parameters and is not for general use Instead, it is accessed via super() in the constructors of various sub-classes that expose a relevant sub-set of the available parameters
MESSAGE_TYPE_BINARY - Static variable in class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.Message
Message ia a binary SMS message with a custom UDH and binary payload
MESSAGE_TYPE_TEXT - Static variable in class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.Message
Message ia a regular TEXT SMS message
MESSAGE_TYPE_UNICODE - Static variable in class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.Message
Message is a unicode message, for sending messages in non-latin script to a supported handset
MESSAGE_TYPE_WAPPUSH - Static variable in class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.Message
Message is a wap-push message to send a browsable / downloadable url to the handset
MESSAGE_TYPE_WAPPUSH - Static variable in class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages.WapPushMessage

NexmoSmsClient - Class in com.nexmo.messaging.sdk
NexmoSmsClient.java

Client for talking to the Nexmo REST interface

Usage To submit a message, first you should instanciate a NexmoSmsClient, passing the credentials for your Nexmo account on the constructor.
NexmoSmsClient(String, String) - Constructor for class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.NexmoSmsClient
Instanciate a new NexmoSmsClient instance that will communicate using the supplied credentials.
NexmoSmsClient(String, String, int, int) - Constructor for class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.NexmoSmsClient
Instanciate a new NexmoSmsClient instance that will communicate using the supplied credentials, and will use the supplied connection and read timeout values.
NexmoSmsClient(String, String, String, int, int) - Constructor for class com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.NexmoSmsClient
Instanciate a new NexmoSmsClient instance that will communicate using the supplied credentials, and will use the supplied connection and read timeout values.
Additionally, you can specify an alternative service base url.

UnicodeMessage - Class in com.nexmo.messaging.sdk.messages
UnicodeMessage.java

Represents the details of a unicode text message that is to be submitted via the Nexmo REST api Unicode messages are required when sending messages to the handset that contain characters that are not within the GSM alphabet.
For example, sending messages in Arabic or Chinese

Created on 5 January 2011, 17:34

This message will be submitted as a unicode 16 bit text message
